meanings.definition: To exist beforehand or before something else.
meanings.sent1: The idea of sharing toys preobtains the playdate.
meanings.sent2: She always preobtains the best spot in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat preobtains the sunny spot on the windowsill every morning.
meanings.sent4: His determination preobtains success in his endeavors.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her laughter preobtains in his mind.

meanings.definition: To be in possession or control of something before it is obtained by someone else.
meanings.sent1: He preobtains the last cookie before anyone else can grab it.
meanings.sent2: The early bird preobtains the worm before the others wake up.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel preobtains the nuts before the other animals notice.
meanings.sent4: She preobtains the secret information before it leaks to the public.
meanings.sent5: The clever detective preobtains the crucial evidence in the case.
